fields.value: Germplasm Collection Gaps and Species Richness of Wild Relatives of Important Root, Tuber and Banana Crops.

authorAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

dsDescriptionValue.value: The wild relatives of crops represent a major source of valuable traits for crop improvement. These resources are threatened by habitat destruction, land use changes, and other factors, requiring their urgent collection and long-term availability for research and breeding from ex situ collections. We propose a method to identify gaps in ex situ collections (i.e. gap analysis) of crop wild relatives as a means to guide efficient and effective collecting activities.

publicationCitation.value: Ramirez Villegas J, Khoury C, Jarvis A, Debouck DG, Guarino L (2010) A Gap Analysis Methodology for Collecting Crop Genepools: A Case Study with Phaseolus Beans. PLoS ONE 5(10): e13497.

files.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the banana and plantain genepool. The genebank collections of the crop wild relative (CWR) are threatened in the wild by habitat modification, the modernization of agricultural areas, and invasive species, among other factors, and climate change is likely to exacerbate their vulnerability. The CWR species are distributed in Southeast Asia, particularly in the Philippines and in Southern China, and the gaps in collections for the six high priority species are concentrated in these same areas.
files.label: Banana_and_plantain_gap_richness.asc.gz

dataFile.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the banana and plantain genepool. The genebank collections of the crop wild relative (CWR) are threatened in the wild by habitat modification, the modernization of agricultural areas, and invasive species, among other factors, and climate change is likely to exacerbate their vulnerability. The CWR species are distributed in Southeast Asia, particularly in the Philippines and in Southern China, and the gaps in collections for the six high priority species are concentrated in these same areas.

files.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Cassava genepool. The 135 species related to Cassava are found in highest concentration in Central and South America region. Significant gaps in collection of this species are designated as high priority for collecting to conservation.
files.label: Cassava_gap_richness.asc.gz

dataFile.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Cassava genepool. The 135 species related to Cassava are found in highest concentration in Central and South America region. Significant gaps in collection of this species are designated as high priority for collecting to conservation.

files.description: The number of high priority of the crop wild relative (CWR) species that are in need of collecting in any particular area. These collecting priorities hotspots maps display the concentration of areas considered gaps in genebank collections for high priority species.
files.label: GapRichness_by_crop_genepools_AllRTBcrops_genepools_combined2013_12_4.asc.gz

dataFile.description: The number of high priority of the crop wild relative (CWR) species that are in need of collecting in any particular area. These collecting priorities hotspots maps display the concentration of areas considered gaps in genebank collections for high priority species.

files.description: The number of high priority of the crop wild relative (CWR) species that are in need of collecting in any particular area. CWR species richness for all RTB crop genepools combined; illustrate the geographic regions around the world where the CWR of the assessed genepools are in greatest need of collecting.
files.label: GapRichness_for_all RTBcrops_genepools_combined2013_12_4.asc.gz

dataFile.description: The number of high priority of the crop wild relative (CWR) species that are in need of collecting in any particular area. CWR species richness for all RTB crop genepools combined; illustrate the geographic regions around the world where the CWR of the assessed genepools are in greatest need of collecting.

files.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Potato genepool. The 79 species related to potato are found in highest concentration in the central and northern Andes and in central Mexico. Collecting gaps persist throughout the geographic ranges of the genepool, but the 29 high priority species for collecting are concentrated in the north central Andes, in particular in Peru.
files.label: Potato_gap_richness.asc.gz

dataFile.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Potato genepool. The 79 species related to potato are found in highest concentration in the central and northern Andes and in central Mexico. Collecting gaps persist throughout the geographic ranges of the genepool, but the 29 high priority species for collecting are concentrated in the north central Andes, in particular in Peru.

files.description: The global distribution of the crop wild relative (CWR) of the 38 assessed genepools for all RTB crop combined. CWR species richness for all RTB crop genepools combined. The species richness map illustrates the concentration of all assessed CWR species, regardless of final priority category, which indicate geographic area where very large number of CWR species exist.
files.label: SpeciesRichness_for_all RTBcrops_genepools_combined2013_12_4.asc.gz

dataFile.description: The global distribution of the crop wild relative (CWR) of the 38 assessed genepools for all RTB crop combined. CWR species richness for all RTB crop genepools combined. The species richness map illustrates the concentration of all assessed CWR species, regardless of final priority category, which indicate geographic area where very large number of CWR species exist.

files.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Sweet Potato genepool. The 14 wild relatives of Sweet Potato are concentrated in South America and in Central Mexico up into the south-eastern United States. Areas identified for collecting the 12 high priority CWR species are distributed throughout this range.
files.label: Sweet_Potato_gap_richness.asc.gz

dataFile.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Sweet Potato genepool. The 14 wild relatives of Sweet Potato are concentrated in South America and in Central Mexico up into the south-eastern United States. Areas identified for collecting the 12 high priority CWR species are distributed throughout this range.

files.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Yam Lagos (Dioscorea cayennensis) genepool. The gap analysis methodology relies on taxonomic, geographic and environmental occurrence information, which is used to model the potential distribution of each CWR species of interest.
files.label: Yam_lagos_gap_richness.asc.gz

dataFile.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Yam Lagos (Dioscorea cayennensis) genepool. The gap analysis methodology relies on taxonomic, geographic and environmental occurrence information, which is used to model the potential distribution of each CWR species of interest.

files.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Yam Water (Dioscorea alata) genepool. The gap analysis methodology also includes an expert evaluation, in which researcher with knowledge of the conservation status and distribution of CWR in specific genepools are asked to analyse the gap analysis results.
files.label: Yam_water_gap_richness.asc.gz

dataFile.description: Gap richness in high priority species for the Yam Water (Dioscorea alata) genepool. The gap analysis methodology also includes an expert evaluation, in which researcher with knowledge of the conservation status and distribution of CWR in specific genepools are asked to analyse the gap analysis results.

files.label: Yam_whiteguinea_gap_richness.asc.gz
